data.title: Other Angle Pictures
data.text:
Other Angle Pictures is a boutique world sales agent, launched 15 years ago by Laurence Schonberg and Olivier Albou. It handles about 10 films a year, most of them being French, and most of the French films being comedies because we like comedies, and we like to see them travel so that people can laugh around the world.

That being said, we tend to diversify into different genres, such as Arthouse films, English language films, Thrillers, Documentaries, basically we will look at any material but we only pick up films that we like, and that we know we can sell.

Being producers as well, we can also build international co-productions and bring some financing to the movies. After two years of Covid, we look forward to seeing our friends and buyers again in the real world and audiences going back to the movies with even more desire than before.

A LITTLE SOMETHING EXTRA

(UN P’TIT TRUC EN PLUS)

#1 opening of the year in France

#1 grossing French film of the year

2,000,000 admissions in 10 days and counting…

To escape the police, a son and his father on the run are forced to find refuge in a summer camp for young adults with disabilities, posing as a resident and his specialized educator. The beginning of trouble and a wonderful human experience that will change them forever.

THE GARDENER

(LE JARDINIER)

Every year the Prime Minister has a list of all kinds of troublemakers eliminated in the name of the famous Reason of State. Serge Shuster, Special Adviser to the President of the Republic, finds himself on this list, better known as the Matignon List.

Condemned to certain death and at the heart of an implacable plot and a state secret that also put his family in danger, Serge, his wife and children have only one hope left - their gardener, Léo, who hates it when « slugs » invade his garden... Especially those that want to kill innocent families.

WE SHOULD HAVE GONE TO GREECE

(ON AURAIT DÛ ALLER EN GRÈCE)

A family with a preppy appearance and established habits (like going to Greece every summer) will spend for the first time Authentic Corsican holidays. Not out of a desire for new things but to hide the financial difficulties of the head of the family (He bought bitcoin en masse and at the worst time!). Almost penniless, he was lent a villa in Corsica in order to counter bad luck good heart. The couple is accompanied by the neurasthenic offspring “Tanguy” style and their eldest daughter who comes to be dropped heavily.

A SMILE DOESN’T LIE

(POURQUOI TU SOURIS ?)

Wisi, smiling despite the hassle, arrives in Bordeaux to start a new life. In order to avoid the street, he passes himself off as a migrant to Marina, who compensates for his loneliness by getting involved in humanitarian action. They meet Jérôme, also on the street, suffering from work phobia and who will secretly lead Wisi into an unmentionable enterprise. Will the unlikely trio lose it all... or win it all ?

HAPPINESS THERAPY

(FÊLÉS)

The members of the Arc-en-ciel home, an authentic community center in Marmande, are ordinary people but violated by life. Psychologically fragile, they are in the middle: neither sick enough to be taken care of by institutions, nor valid enough to face the violence of the world alone. They therefore find refuge in this incredible little house, their Noah’s ark, of which they are president, secretary, treasurer, and above all decision-makers of the activities. They manage themselves there under the leadership of Pierre, the founder of the place, who leads a daily fight to ensure its sustainability... This home turns out to be the last bastion of the methods of François Tosquelles, a brilliant psychiatrist who became a revolutionary by suppressing all visual, functional or administrative barriers between caregivers and patients.

DON’T WORRY ABOUT ME

(TKT)

As Emma lies in the hospital’s intensive care unit, her parents anxiously await news from the doctor. However, Emma finds herself in an ethereal state, fully conscious yet in a coma. Struggling to comprehend her predicament, Emma must delve into her memories to uncover the events leading to her current condition. As she navigates through her past, she unravels the mystery surrounding her sudden hospitalization, ultimately facing the truth of what happened to her.

HER AND HIM AND THE REST OF THE WORLD

(ELLE ET LUI ET LE RESTE DU MONDE)

Marco, in his twenties, is filling in for his friend on Valentine’s day at an emergency call center for an elevator company. Around 3am, a young woman calls, she is stuck in an elevator, in a panic attack. Marco tries to calm her down on the phone but he has no technician available to rescue her. He finally decides to go it alone and rescue the girl, and then starts a romantic evening in Paris…

SIRENS

(SIRÈNES)

Recently graduated from Paris police school, Leila Balani reluctantly enters the Nice police to train on the field, whereas as her specialty is criminology. Her boss puts her together with captain Alison Flesh, an intrepid and rebel local who cannot stand Parisians or team work... Then starts a roller coaster investigation on the trail of a serial killer. Flesh and Balani are going to have to team up to save lives and make a mess around all the Riviera.

FALLEN FROM THE TRUCK

(TOMBÉS DU CAMION)

Stanislas, a fisherman, loses everything when his boat breaks down. Too old, analphabet, he decides to join forces with old fishermen who attack trucks on the road. It is very risky for Stanlislas as his own sons are police officers. When things go wrong, he ends up with a box in which he finds a 10 year old boy…

MY MOTHERLAND

(MA FRANCE À MOI)

France lives alone in her apartment since her husband’s death. When she hears on the radio that an NGO is putting in touch homeless migrants and people who are ready to welcome them, she decides, against her family’s opinion to welcome Reza, a young Afgan broken by war and exile. Two worlds colide, and begin to hold each other’s hand.

FLO

(FLO)

Florence Arthaud, celebrated solo sailor, is the only woman to have ever won the grueling trans-Atlantic Route du Rhum.

FLO is the story of a fiercely free woman who rejected her conventional bourgeois surroundings to follow her dreams in challenging the sea and became a worldwide inspiration.

HANDS OF GOLD

(DES MAINS EN OR)

Philippe is a recognized writer, whose life went off without a hitch: a surgeon wife, a circle of high-ranking friends, a Parisian mansion... And above all, an imminent entry into the French Academy. Except that Philippe suffers from terrible back pain which poisons his existence. When he meets the incredible Martha, who picks him up after a car accident on the roads of Normandy, his view of the world changes. With her gentle madness and her healing hands, this woman who seems so free attaches herself above all to caring for others even if it means forgetting herself. Between these two characters that everything opposes, an amazing friendship is woven, with the opportunity for them to finally seize the best that life can offer them.

SWEET LITTLE THINGS

(LES PETITES VICTOIRES)

Between her obligations as a mayor and her role as a teacher in the little village of Kerguen, Alice’s days are really full. Emile, an explosive 60 year old has finally decided to learn how to read and write, and arrives in her class, will make her days even more impossible, now that suddenly, Alice has to save her village and her school.

THE MIDWIFE

(SAGE HOMME)

While his modest family had great hopes for him, Leopold, a 19-year old medicine student, fails at his final exam. He decides to hide the truth from them and accepts to enter the midwifery school, planning on joining back medical school later through a bridge. Raised exclusively among men, Leopold starts this course half-hearted. His tutor Nathalie, a strong-willed and experienced midwife, will soon make him change his view on this astonishing world and question his certainties.

SERIAL DRIVER

(PAS PERMIS)

Serial Driver is a parody of a genre film, a quirky comedy, in which a woman, a psychologist and instructor of driver’s license recovery courses, waits for the driver who killed her husband to get out of prison in order to avenge him.She trains by applying her very particular conception of road safety, which is to eradicate the trainees that she considers irredeemable and who could become dangerous drivers. Meanwhile, two atypical cops are investigating, determined to stop this elusive serial killer of the wheel.

HAWAII

(HAWAÏ)

Nine friends gather every year in their friend Thomas’ hotel in Hawaii. Following a nuclear attack alert, they believe that their last moments are upon them. Years of hidden truths, resentment and bitterness starts to resurface and their friendly annual meeting soon turns into an aggressive (and really funny) score-setting shouting match. Fortunately for them, the nuclear threat is a false alert, unfortunately for them, they have to spend the remaining eight days of vacation together...

THE SNOW MUST GO ON

(LES TÊTES GIVRÉES)

Alain, a former mountain guide, decides to change the course of his life to become a teacher. Facing a group of challengingly colourful teenagers, Alain struggles to stimulate them. In a teambuilding effort, he arranges a field trip to… the heart of a glacier! The breath-taking beauty of the icy caves leaves the students in awe. They return to class appalled by the idea that the glacier might disappear due to global warming. With the support and guidance of Alain, they embark on a crazy mission: prevent the glacier from melting… and nothing will stop them!

MAISON DE RETRAITE

(RETIREMENT HOME)

An unlikely story of friendship between Milann, a young convict who is forced to work in a retirement home rather than going to jail, and a larger than life group of retired people who are not really prepared to accept this new recruit. That’s until they find out that Milann is an orphan like them and they decide to let him in. He also discovers something is wrong as the old people never receive any visit, and the retirement home is stealing their money. He decides to help them and organize an escape. But where would they go?
